description: Representative Jim Costa (CA-21), a senior member of the House Agriculture Committee and member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, seeks a friendly, organized, and detail-oriented Staff Assistant/Legislative Correspondent to manage the front office and constituent mail program in his Washington D.C. description:
The Office of U.S. Rep. Jonathan L. Jackson has an immediate need to hire an experienced full-time Communications Director in the Washington, D.C., office to lead a fast-paced and highly engaged press operation.

The Communications Director will serve as the spokesperson and primary communications advisor to the Member. They will be responsible for developing and executing an aggressive strategic communications plan, including social media, that encompasses local, national, and specialty media outlets.
responsibilities: Reports to Chief of Staff and Deputy Chief of Staff;
Develops and implements media and communications strategy for the Member;
Tracks current legislative and non-legislative issues about which the Member may be questioned;
Evaluates current events and media reports in the district and the nation for their impact on the Member;
Provides ideas and advice on the effect in the media of the Member's actions and legislative activities;
Writes remarks and speeches for the Member; and
Performs other duties as assigned.
qualifications: Bachelor’s or master’s degree;
2-5 years of Capitol Hill experience (this is NOT an entry-level position);
Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills;
Strong relationships with reporters and ability to regularly pitch stories;
Understanding of print, digital, and broadcast media;
Knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved;
Understanding of House franking rules; and
Ability to work well under pressure and to work cooperatively and courteously with others.
how_to_apply: All interested candidates are encouraged to submit a cover letter, a writing sample, a list of three references, and a resume by Friday, January 26, 2024, to LaTreshia Hamilton at LaTreshia.Hamilton01@mail.house.gov. Incomplete applications will not be considered.
equal_opportunity: All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including marital or parental status), sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, or national origin.

description:
Rep. Kevin Mullin (CA-15) is seeking a Senior Legislative Assistant to manage
his work in the environment, clean energy, water, wildlife, and climate change
portfolios and to take the lead on other issue areas dependent on the interests of
the person and needs of the office. The person in this role will primarily focus on
Rep. Mullin’s work on the Natural Resources Committee, but will support his
other committee work (Science, Space, and Technology) and/or other issues as
needed.

Rep. Mullin’s first pieces of legislation in Congress focused on environmental
justice, equity for marginalized communities, and combating poverty. The person
in this role should be interested and excited to approach policy work through this
lens.

The Senior Legislative Assistant will report to the Legislative Director and will
have regular interaction with Rep. Mullin as well as with other legislative,
communications, operations, and District staff. The ideal candidate will have 2-3
years of prior experience as a Legislative Assistant or comparable policy
experience, significant education and/or work experience on issues under the
jurisdiction of the Natural Resources Committee, and a commitment to public
service.
responsibilities:
Building relationships and working closely with Hill staff, governmental
officials, outside organizations, constituents, and other stakeholders

Advancing the Member’s policy priorities via legislation, letters, and other
opportunities

Tracking legislation, formulating vote recommendations, and generating policy
ideas

Preparing the Member for and staffing him in stakeholder meetings, hearings,
markups, Floor votes, and related events as needed
Representing the Member in meetings with constituents and stakeholders
Closely monitoring and engaging in committee work

Making recommendations to the Member on Floor and committee votes and on
other actions, such as cosponsoring legislation and co-signing letters

Drafting memos, legislation, letters, committee and Floor remarks, talking
points, and other written material
Traveling to/from the District as needed

Performing other duties as assigned by the Legislative Director and Chief of
Staff
qualifications:
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including being able to write
quickly and effectively with little oversight

Interpersonal skills demonstrated by positive working relationships across the
political spectrum
Deep understanding of the legislative process and procedures

A demonstrable record of developing and advancing legislation and other policy
vehicles
The ability to collaborate respectfully and productively on a small team
Exceptional organizational skills
Effectively balancing high attention to detail with the need for efficiency
The ability to stay calm under pressure
Interest in and ability to adapt to feedback
The ability to take initiative in a fast-paced setting

description:

This position will lead on all issues within the jurisdiction of the Judiciary Committee (except Immigration), which include but are not limited to: antitrust, courts, criminal justice, elections, protection of civil rights and civil liberties, and intellectual property.

Advancing current and new legislative initiatives including idea generation, building support, legislative drafting and producing accompanying materials, such as speeches, policy memos, and factsheets;
Developing expertise in new issue areas as they arise;
Representing the Congresswoman's priorities with external stakeholders;
Building and maintaining relationships with external and internal stakeholders including advocacy organizations; academics; fellow Congressional and Committee offices; and
Carrying out additional duties as required.

Excellent writing and time management skills;
Ability to digest new content with a political and ideological lens that is appropriate for the office;
Previous Hill experience strongly preferred;
Poised, level-headed, flexible, collaborative, team oriented; and
Eager to learn, grow, and thrive in a dynamic and high-paced environment.

position_title: Member Services Director, Congressional Black Caucus (CBC)
description:
The Congressional Black Caucus (CBC) seeks a Member Services Director who
is exceptionally motivated, dynamic, strategic, and detail-oriented to engage with
CBC Member offices and outside partners to advance a robust member services
portfolio.

The Member Services Director will be expected to proactively build strong
relationships across CBC Member offices and develop strategic opportunities for
Member engagement advancing shared priorities. The individual will also be
expected to coordinate with CBC staff to field and respond to inquiries and
requests for support from Member offices and respond to and share external
opportunities for Member engagement as they arise.

The Member Services Director is also responsible for assisting in overseeing all
aspects of caucus operations, logistics, designated administrative responsibilities
and to support caucus leadership.
responsibilities:
Conducting regular outreach to Member offices to build relationships with staff,
share opportunities for Member or staff participation in events, messaging, and
other efforts, and identify new ideas for collaboration with Member offices

Sharing resources with Member offices and working with CBC, congressional,
and external staff to develop high-quality materials for Member office use

Drafting regular newsletters for Member offices with relevant updates and
opportunities, as well as for external audiences to uplift Member engagement on
CBC issues

Developing a network of external partners working on issues relevant to the
CBC and Member offices
Maintaining staff contact information and distribution lists
Provides orientation and training for new staff;

Supervises the mail operations and the administrative files and personnel
records;
Assists staff in scheduling House or Capitol rooms for outside group functions;
Organize and facilitate meetings and other strategic convenings to support institutional
change, policies, and programmatic work;
Oversees operations for CBC including organizing weekly meetings and events
Provides logistical support for all programming

Works with the CBC personal office staffs and coordinates with the CBC
Schedulers to implement the Caucus’ priorities
Builds and maintains databases of internal and external stakeholders
qualifications:
Qualified candidates must have an understanding of CBC policy priorities and
familiarity working with the African American community.

Outstanding writing
and communication skills, sound political judgment, and the ability to work
closely and collaboratively with multiple Member offices and key stakeholders
are essential.

Top candidates should also be detail-oriented and possess the ability
to multi-task, work well in a fast-paced setting, and act as a team player.

Candidates should have a demonstrated understanding of House and Senate
legislative processes.

description:

The successful candidate will have a creative and strategic approach to visual and graphic design, excellent oral and written communications skills, an ability to handle multiple assignments on tight deadlines, a desire to hone the Member’s voice, a strong collaborative approach to cross functional teaming, and a good sense of humor. This is not an entry level position. description:
The Office of Congressional Ethics (OCE), an independent, non-partisan investigative entity established by the United States House of Representatives, seeks one attorney with 5-10 years of experience to serve as Investigative Counsel.

The Investigative Counsel reports to the Staff Director and Chief Counsel and will be responsible for conducting sensitive inquiries into allegations of possible violations of federal law and ethical standards of conduct by current Members, Officers and Staff of the House of Representatives and advising the Staff Director and Chief Counsel on legal and policy matters.

The OCE is seeking attorneys interested in the OCE’s work supporting ethics and transparency within the House of Representatives. The Investigative Counsel would join a small, Washington, DC-based, investigative team, and would be eligible to apply for hybrid work accommodations combining in-person core days and remote work.
responsibilities: Review information received by OCE, discern possible violations, and identify facts requiring further investigation
Plan, organize and conduct investigations regarding allegations and advise the Staff Director and Chief Counsel regarding appropriate evaluation of cases
Advise the Staff Director and Chief Counsel on legal issues in matters under investigation and on broader legal and policy issues involved in the operations of OCE
Draft lengthy and detailed memoranda, reports, and referrals for Board consideration and potential public release
Developing investigative strategies and implementing investigative plans
Reviewing evidence and data in order to analyze, develop, and provide detailed written and oral reports of findings
Identifying information to substantiate or disprove allegations and assess the likely sources of that information
Collecting and reviewing documents, electronic media, and physical evidence
Interviewing witnesses and subjects
Performing other duties as assigned
qualifications: Demonstrated ability to conduct and direct complex legal research and present the results in a clear, precise and persuasive manner
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong legal judgment and demonstrated professional integrity
Experience auditing large sets of data or evidence and providing detailed analysis
Investigative experience with high-profile and sensitive matters
Experience with investigations involving public officials
Experience with campaign finance or ethics law
Experience conducting interviews or depositions
Experience writing public reports or legal documents
Advanced proficiency in development and use of electronic databases, and other computer skills including knowledge of current information technology tools related to investigations
work independently or as part of an investigative team
manage multiple tasks and projects
work well under pressure and tight time deadlines
exercise discretion and independent judgment
Ability to pass Security Background Investigation to obtain Top Secret clearance
Graduation from an ABA accredited law school and active bar membership
